verses.kjv: O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:
verses.ct: LORD my God, I place my trust in you. Rescue me from everyone who hunts me down, and save me,

verses.kjv: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
verses.ct: before they rip my soul apart like a lion, tearing it to pieces with no one to save me.

verses.kjv: O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;
verses.ct: LORD my God, if I have done what they accuse me of — if there is guilt on my hands —

verses.kjv: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)
verses.ct: if I have repaid a friend with harm (instead, I even set free someone who was my enemy for no reason) —

verses.kjv: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.
verses.ct: then let my enemy chase me down and catch me. Let him trample my life into the ground and leave my reputation in the dirt. Selah.

verses.kjv: Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.
verses.ct: Rise up, LORD, in your anger! Stand up against the fury of my enemies! Wake up on my behalf and carry out the justice you have ordered.

verses.kjv: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.
verses.ct: Let the assembled nations gather around you, and from your place above, preside over them.

verses.kjv: The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.
verses.ct: The LORD passes judgment on all people. Vindicate me, LORD, based on my righteousness and the integrity that is in me.

verses.kjv: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
verses.ct: Put an end to the evil of the wicked, but strengthen those who do right, because the righteous God examines every heart and mind.

verses.kjv: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.
verses.ct: My shield comes from God, who saves those whose hearts are honest.

verses.kjv: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.
verses.ct: God is a just judge, and he is angry with the wicked every single day.

verses.kjv: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
verses.ct: If a person does not turn back, God will sharpen his sword. He has already strung his bow and prepared it.

verses.kjv: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.
verses.ct: He has readied his deadly weapons and made his arrows into flaming projectiles.

verses.kjv: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.
verses.ct: Look at the wicked person — he is pregnant with evil, has conceived trouble, and gives birth to lies.

verses.kjv: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.
verses.ct: He dug a deep pit as a trap, but he himself fell into the hole he made.

verses.kjv: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.
verses.ct: The trouble he planned will come back on his own head, and his violence will crash down on his own skull.

verses.kjv: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.
verses.ct: I will thank the LORD for his righteousness, and I will sing praise to the name of the LORD Most High.
